conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a parody movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text:
It sounds like you're in for a fun night! If you enjoy a blend of drama and humor, "Hollywood Ending" directed by Woody Allen might be right up your alley. This film revolves around a director who goes blind just before his movie starts shooting, adding an unexpected twist to the production process.

Alternatively, if you're looking for something a bit more suspenseful with a touch of horror, "The Shadows" could be a great choice. This film follows a horror novelist who forms an unlikely friendship that soon turns dangerous, with a plot that's almost straight out of one of his own books! Enjoy the movies!

This film is a satire that humorously combines various disaster movies and stars Tony Cox and Carmen Electra. Another one that might tickle your fancy is "George of the Jungle", a fun and quirky comedy with Brendan Fraser playing a man raised by apes in the jungle. Both films offer an entertaining twist on familiar genres!

I'd highly recommend checking out "Wag the Dog" if you're in the mood for a clever and entertaining parody film. Starring Dustin Hoffman and Robert De Niro, this movie tells the story of political spin doctors trying to fabricate a war to cover up a Presidential scandal. It's a great blend of comedy and satire that might tickle your fancy!

If you're interested in something with action-packed drama, "Training Day" featuring Denzel Washington and Ethan Hawke is an excellent choice. The story revolves around a rookie cop navigating a day with a corrupt narcotics officer, providing a gripping portrayal of the complexities of the criminal underworld. Enjoy!
